messages: b298c80f5802052d219d5628662d71be (05:49): runtime: the easiest way to do it ... is to compile the app on each "system revision" that you want it to run on ... ie ... redhat 6.0, redhat 6.1, fedora x, debian 3.0, debian 3.1, etc etc ... as they all have different libraries .... qt uses X and other libs, which are all different accross the systems .... this is why you dont get "simple binary installers for linux" like you do on doze ... its just not that simple
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:50): sema4: So you're saying to compile on redhat get redhat and compile while using that OS?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:50): sema4: There are no alternatives at all?
b298c80f5802052d219d5628662d71be (05:50): runtime: not that I know of ...
b298c80f5802052d219d5628662d71be (05:51): runtime: this is (i could be wrong) the same reason you hear kde dever's talking about "binary compatability"
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:51): does anyone else know of an alternative?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:52): I have ubuntu
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:52): but I dont want to install it, so Im going to have to do livecd
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:52): and that takes a lot of time to get internet working and etc. etc.
b298c80f5802052d219d5628662d71be (05:52): runtime: does live cd have the dev libs?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:53): sema4: I don't know, I never even attempted at development on a platform other thatn windows and mac
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:53): sema4: I think it has everything that the real OS does, but it gets it off the cd
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (05:53): runtime: what's your trouble man?
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (05:54): if i've got it, i think you can just setup a chroot environment with the os you need.
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:55): aolph1: I want to compile binaries that work with Linux and/or Mac from a Windows platform
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (05:55): maybe you can do even better, getting just the libraries you need to compile the stuff... but it is a lot of work.
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (05:56): aloph1: how would I do that?
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (05:56): woo! i think its a bit complicated...
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (05:58): runtime: well. i first would try to get at least any unix machine to try to do that...
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (05:59): if unsucessful, i think i would first try to move to another job! eheheh
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (06:00): now serious, i think maybe its possible.
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (06:00): but it would get a lot of work.
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (06:01): i would try to learn how netbsd people can compile the whole operating system from foreigner OSes...
2b6db9846d8b0dc02911bb2a7747880e (06:01): can't remember right now, but maybe netbsd can be built even from a windows machine with interix.
